intro: Anemopaegma tobagense, commonly known as the Toba anemopaegma, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Toba in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are ovate and hairy, providing a textured appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
